details: Do not pull rotor blades down as damage may occur.  To lower one blade, push opposite blade up.
Verify erosion on lower surface of blades has not exposed skin-to-spar bond line.  Reference Rotor Systems Description in Section 7.
For helicopters with removable controls, remove left seat controls if person in that seat is not a rated helicopter pilot.
Be sure rotor blades are approximately level to avoid possible tailcone strike.
When flying solo, fill left baggage compartment to capacity before using right compartment.  Avoid placing objects in compartments which could injure occupant if seat collapses during a hard landing.
Shorter pilots may require cushion to obtain full travel of all controls.  Verify aft cyclic travel is not restricted.
Mixture guard is not used on aircraft with vernier mixture control on console face.
CAT Rise / Drop, Set as Required
Avoid continuous operation at rotor speed of 60 to 70% to minimize tail resonance.
On slippery surfaces, be prepared to counter nose-right rotation with left pedal as governor increases RPM.
Before takeoff, pilot should uncover one ear and listen for any unusual noise which may indicate impending failure of a bearing or other component.
Slowly raise collective until aircraft is light on skids.  Reposition cyclic as required for equilibrium, then gently lift aircraft into hover.
And Accelerate to Climb Speed (per H/V Diagram)
If RPM drops below 102%, lower collective.
Set with Collective for Desired Power
Exercise extreme care never to inadvertently pull mixture control as engine stoppage will result.
In-flight leaning with engine mixture control is not recommended.  Engine stoppage may result as there is no propeller to keep engine turning should over leaning occur.
Avionics, Alt, Battery and Ignition Switches
Do not slow rotor by raising collective during shutdown.  Blades may flap and strike tailcone.
During idle and after engine shutdown, pilot should uncover on ear and listen for unusual noise which may indicate impending failure of a bearing or other component.
Pin In Line WIth No Marks
CAUTION! Avoid continuous operation at rotor speed of 60 to 70% to minimize tail rotor resonance.
Note CAT Rise and Fall in ERPM
Governor On, Inc Throttle and Guard
